backend/main.mo: Main backend actor handling authorization, invite-only mode, user approvals, profile storage, and match-related type definitions.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report listing feature IDs, descriptions, file impacts, components, tests, and confidence levels.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Collection of short summaries for numerous frontend components and pages describing their roles and behaviors.
frontend/docs/v48-modecard-resume-button: Documentation describing the ModeCard UI change that moves the Resume button below Start New Game.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind CSS setup defining theme variables, light/dark mode tokens, and global styling.
frontend/index.html: Base HTML file loading the root React application and main module script.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Top-level React router configuration with routes, error boundaries, layout, and AuthGate integration.
frontend/src/components/accepting-gifts/: Card/table component that displays Accepting Gifts win/loss performance by starting ball count.
frontend/src/components/apa/ApaBallButto: Button component for representing an APA ball with scoring state styles and accessibility labels.
frontend/src/components/apa/apaBallStyle: Defines ball state types and helpers including ball values and rack total calculations with one‑away 9‑ball adjustments.
frontend/src/components/apa/ApaRackScori: Manages per-rack APA 9-ball scoring, ball states, defensive shots, auto-dead-ball logic, inning flow, and sends rack updates and completion data.
frontend/src/components/apa/ApaResultsSu: Displays post-match summary showing winner, match points, and detailed stats for both players such as skill level, points, innings, and PPI.
frontend/src/components/apa/RealApaMatch: Provides a form to create or edit APA match logs with validation, identity checks, and save/update mutations.
frontend/src/components/apa/useApaInning: React hook that tracks active player, shared innings, and inning transitions for APA rack play.
frontend/src/components/auth/AuthGate.ts: Controls access by checking identity, approval, admin status, and invite-only mode before rendering protected content.
frontend/src/components/auth/LoginButton: Button that handles login/logout via Internet Identity and clears cached queries on logout.
frontend/src/components/auth/ProfileSetu: Dialog for creating or editing a user profile, handling identity state, backend readiness, and saving profile data.
frontend/src/components/history/MatchHis: Renders a match history table with APA-derived stats and navigation to match details.
frontend/src/components/layout/AppLayout: App-wide layout with header, navigation buttons, connection status, profile setup, and routed content.
frontend/src/components/matches/DeleteMa: Button and confirmation dialog to delete a match and optionally navigate afterward.
frontend/src/components/matches/EndMatch: Reusable confirmation dialog for ending a match with customizable text and pending state.
frontend/src/components/matches/MatchSum: Summary card displaying key match info, mode labels, and computed outcome or score.
frontend/src/components/navigation/ModeC: Card UI for starting or resuming a game mode with navigation and session resume support.
frontend/src/components/players/ApaAggre: Generates multiple APA performance trend datasets from match data and renders charts with Recharts.
frontend/src/components/straight-shot/St: Builds a frequency histogram from shot counts and displays it in a bar chart.
Displays a summary table of wins, losses, and first-win dates grouped by ball count.
Shows shot-count trends over time using a combined bar and line chart with an average indicator.
frontend/src/dev/straight-shot-spot-chec: Manual QA checklist for verifying Straight Shot session flow and correctness after code changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Initializes and caches a backend actor based on Internet Identity, refetching dependent queries on change.
frontend/src/hooks/useActorRetry.ts: Provides a helper to clear and refetch the actor query to retry backend connection.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Manages Internet Identity auth state, login, logout, and identity persistence via context.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: React Query hooks for fetching and mutating match data, user profiles, approvals, and related backend calls.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind base/theme configuration defining CSS variables for light and dark UI color palettes.
frontend/src/lib/accepting-gifts/accepti: Defines game state and provides helpers to clamp ball counts, apply attempt results, and advance to the next set.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaAggregateStats.t: Extracts APA match stats for a player and computes PPI/aPPI data points and best‑of‑20 averages.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaEqualizer.ts: Provides APA skill levels, points‑to‑win mapping, and formatting/validation utilities.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaMatchPoints.ts: Defines the 20‑point match outcome chart and thresholds for converting loser points to match scores.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaPracticeMatchOut: Computes APA practice match outcomes using targets, loser SL, and point‑conversion charts.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaScoring.ts: Implements APA rack scoring utilities, PPI calculation, and player stats aggregation.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaSkillLevelPredic: Predicts APA skill level based on PPI or aPPI ranges.
frontend/src/lib/apa/officialApaExpected: Provides the official expected PPI table with win‑percent buckets and lookup helpers.
Determines official APA match outcome from scores and skill levels, with fallback to didWin flag.
frontend/src/lib/apa/officialApaPpi.ts: Implements PPI/aPPI calculations, input validation, win-percentage lookup, and context-dependent Official APA aPPI computation.
frontend/src/lib/history/matchHistoryRow: Builds human-readable match result strings for various match modes including Official APA, APA practice, Accepting Gifts, and Straight Shot.
frontend/src/lib/matches/effectiveMatchD: Parses official match dates safely and computes a consistent effective timestamp for sorting and display.
frontend/src/lib/matches/matchBuilders.t: Builds Official APA match log records and re-exports other match builders, deriving outcome when skill levels and scores are available.
frontend/src/lib/matches/matchBuildersOr: Contains builders for APA Nine Ball, Accepting Gifts, and other legacy match modes, constructing match records with detailed stats.
frontend/src/lib/session/inProgressSessi: Provides helpers to check, clear, and list in-progress sessionStorage entries for different game modes.
frontend/src/lib/stats/acceptingGiftsPer: Computes Accepting Gifts win/loss totals grouped by starting ball count from match history.
frontend/src/lib/stats/acceptingGiftsSta: Calculates summary stats for Accepting Gifts sessions, including total sessions and rolling average of ending ball counts.
Computes aggregated Official APA stats including win rate, average PPI, and average aPPI across applicable matches.
frontend/src/lib/stats/straightShotStats: Computes statistics for straight-shot matches including averages, trends, histogram data, and win/loss summaries.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Initializes React app with query client and Internet Identity provider, then renders the root App component.
frontend/src/pages/accepting-gifts/Accep: Manages the Accepting Gifts game session state, handling attempts, set progression, persistence, and match saving.
Shows rules and guidance for the Accepting Gifts drill including objectives, setup, scoring, and tips.
Allows users to start or resume an Accepting Gifts session, configure initial details, and view rules.
Loads and manages APA practice game state, handles rack scoring, completion logic, and saving the match.
frontend/src/pages/apa/PracticeStartPage: Collects player names and skill levels to start a new APA practice game, handling validation and in‑progress sessions.
frontend/src/pages/apa/RealApaMatchEditP: Fetches an existing official APA match and renders a form for editing its logged data.
frontend/src/pages/apa/RealApaMatchPlace: Provides a page to create a new official APA match log using the form component.
frontend/src/pages/auth/AccessNotAllowed: Shows an access-denied message and allows users to request approval to use the app.
frontend/src/pages/history/MatchDetailsP: Displays detailed information for a specific match, including APA-specific stats and navigation options.
frontend/src/pages/history/MatchHistoryP: Shows sortable match history with card and table views, grouped by match mode.
frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx: Displays the home dashboard with navigation cards for all game modes and match history access.
frontend/src/pages/owner/OwnerApprovalsP: Admin page to view and manage user approval requests and toggle invite-only mode.
frontend/src/pages/players/PlayerAggrega: Displays a player's APA aggregate stats, charts, win rate, and predicted skill levels.
frontend/src/pages/SmokeCheckPage.tsx: Provides a deployment verification page with basic navigation tests to Home and Match History.
frontend/src/pages/stats/StatsPage.tsx: Shows the logged-in user's aggregated stats across multiple modes with navigation to detailed views.
frontend/src/pages/straight-shot/Straigh: Runs an in-progress Straight Shot session, saving state and submitting the completed match.
Presents rules and instructions for the Straight Shot drill.
Starts a new Straight Shot session, showing recent averages and handling in‑progress session conflicts.
frontend/src/utils/errorText.ts: Extracts a readable error message from various error shapes.
frontend/src/utils/playerName.ts: Provides utilities for normalizing and comparing player names.
frontend/src/utils/playerRoutes.ts: Builds URL paths for navigating to player stats pages.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Helpers for reading URL params (including hash routing), storing them in sessionStorage, and retrieving or clearing persisted values.
frontend/src/utils/withTimeout.ts: Wraps a promise with a timeout and rejects with an error if the timeout is exceeded.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind configuration defining theme extensions, color tokens, animations, and plugin setup.
project_state.json: Project state file describing current build version, scoped upcoming work on APA stats/graphs, architectural notes, and known issues.
